newsitem.title: USA: KEDO seeks 42,000 tonnes no.6 fuel oil for May.
newsitem.headline: KEDO seeks 42,000 tonnes no.6 fuel oil for May.

text.p: The Korean Peninsula Energy Development is tendering for 42,000 tonnes of Number 6 maximum two percent sulfur residual fuel oil for May delivery to Nampo/Songrim and/or Sonbong ports in North Korea, KEDO's brokers International Services Corp said Thursday.
KEDO, an organization set up to carry out an international accord designed to freeze North Korea's nuclear weapons program, has agreed to supply the country with 500,000 tonnes of fuel oil a year.
